Found out how to re-create.  Happened on I20050331

- open a java file (that is managed in CVS)
- open the "CVS Resource History" view
- detach the CVS Resource History view
- while it has focus hit esc, to hide it
- no go to the file in the editor and popup a menu and choose Team > Show
Resource History

- SWT Exception will occur.. .widget is disposed.

Thank you so much, Michael! That generates the error every time.
Fixed in HEAD (the patch also fixes bug 92012)
Still a problem with build i0426-0849. Same stack trace as original report.

This bug in combination with bug 92771 made my Eclipse workbench unusable.

I cloned the window and then closed my original one (which resulted in the NPE
in my log. 

Closing the cloned window does not show the problem.

Okay... I can't find steps to reproduce the original stack trace, but I managed
to make my detached views unusable with the following steps:

1. Default Java perspective
2. detach the package explorer
3. default debug perspective
4. Open and detach package explorer
5. close package explorer with esc
6. return to java perspective
7. close package explorer with esc
8. return to debug perspective

I'm not 100% certain that this is the exact same problem that DJ is seeing,
since I managed to get quite different stack traces by reordering the steps
above (and none of them is identical to the original one).

The detached window is prematurely disposing the view's widgets when the same
detached shell gets reused and closed more than once (the hideViewsOnClose flag
was not being reset the second time). This means the stack traces could be
widely varied since the exception would only get thrown the next time the view
gets touched.

My steps above and michael's steps from comment 4 both work now, so I believe
this is fixed. Please reopen if you discover any other scenarios in which this
can be reproduced.

BTW, I've also added some error checking to generate more informative stack
traces if something causes view or detached shell widgets to be prematurely
disposed.
